title: Cancer Super-Survivors May Hold Keys to New Treatments
summary: Historically, cancer research has probed the drivers of the disease’s evolution, asking why people get cancer. But some scientists are widening their scope to study patients who never develop cancer in the first place — or survive against the odds.
fullContent: Historically, cancer research has probed the drivers of the disease’s evolution, asking why people get cancer. But some scientists are widening their scope to study patients who never develop cancer in the first place — or survive against the odds. Can this recent vein of research lead to better prevention?

title: Scotland’s Wind Turbines Are Being Paid to Stand Still 37% of the Time
summary: Operators of wind turbines in Scotland were paid to switch their turbines off 37% of the time over the first half of the year, the Financial Times has reported, an amount equal to 4 TWh that were not produced due to lack of demand and infrastructure to bring the electricity to...
fullContent: Operators of wind turbines in Scotland were paid to switch their turbines off 37% of the time over the first half of the year, the Financial Times has reported, an amount equal to 4 TWh that were not produced due to lack of demand and infrastructure to bring the electricity to where there was demand. The report noted that the amount curtailed from wind turbines in Scotland accounted for 86% of the total curtailment across Britain over the six months from January to June. It added that this represented a 15% increase on last year’s first-half…

title: Australia To Recognise Palestinian State By September In UN: Australian PM Anthony Albanese
UK Homelessness Minister Quits After Making Her Own Tenants Homeless
summary: UK Homelessness Minister Quits After Making Her Own Tenants Homeless Authored by Thomas Brooke via Remix News, Rushanara Ali has resigned from her role as Minister for Homelessness in Keir Starmer’s left-wing government following reports that she removed tenants from her east...
fullContent: UK Homelessness Minister Quits After Making Her Own Tenants Homeless Authored by Thomas Brooke via Remix News, Rushanara Ali has resigned from her role as Minister for Homelessness in Keir Starmer’s left-wing government following reports that she removed tenants from her east London townhouse and relisted the property with a £700-per-month rent increase. The revelations, first reported by the i Paper, raised concerns about a perceived conflict between Ali’s personal actions as a landlord and her public stance on housing policy. Bangladeshi-born Ali, who represents Bethnal Green and Stepney, submitted her resignation to Prime Minister Keir Starmer in a letter late on Thursday. She wrote, “It is with a heavy heart that I offer you my resignation as a Minister,” and emphasized that she had always followed legal requirements, stating, “I believe I took my responsibilities and duties seriously, and the facts demonstrate this.” It has been an honour to have served in this Labour Government. To avoid any further distraction for the government, I have resigned as a Minister. My letter to the Prime Minister.https://t.co/fOes7m3cUH pic.twitter.com/TNJIXxzhWU — Rushanara Ali MP 💙 (@rushanaraali) August 7, 2025 The MP said she was stepping down because her continued presence in the role would be “a distraction from the ambitious work of the government.” She cited supposed achievements made during her tenure, including tackling rough sleeping, strengthening democracy, and developing a pathway to end the war in Gaza. It is unclear why a homelessness minister elected by Brits in the United Kingdom considered the war in Gaza to be on her list of priorities. Ali has previously spoken out against landlords who exploit private renters and supported Labour’s upcoming Renters’ Rights Bill, which will bar landlords from relisting properties at higher rents within six months of ending a tenancy to sell. A source close to Ali claimed the tenants were told their lease would not be renewed and were offered the option of staying on a rolling contract. The source said the house was initially put up for sale, and only relisted for rent after a buyer was not found. In response to her resignation, Prime Minister Keir Starmer thanked Ali for her work in government. “Your diligent work at the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government, including your efforts to put in measures to repeal the Vagrancy Act, will have a significant impact,” he wrote. “I know you will continue to support the Government from the backbenches and represent the best interests of your constituents in Bethnal Green and Stepney.” Read more here... Tyler Durden Mon, 08/11/2025 - 02:45

summary: BlueStone Jewellery's Rs 1,541 crore IPO witnessed a slow start, with subscriptions at 4% on day one and a modest grey market premium. The IPO, priced at Rs 492-517, aims to raise funds through fresh issues and an offer for sale.
fullContent: BlueStone Jewellery's Rs 1,541 crore IPO witnessed a slow start, with subscriptions at 4% on day one and a modest grey market premium. The IPO, priced at Rs 492-517, aims to raise funds through fresh issues and an offer for sale. SBI Securities recommends subscribing for the long term, citing strong revenue growth and market position despite current losses.

title: SoftBank selects banks for US IPO of payments app PayPay: Report
summary: SoftBank is reportedly preparing to list its Japanese payments app operator, PayPay, in the United States, potentially raising over $2 billion. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase & Co, Mizuho Financial Group, and Morgan Stanley are leading the IPO preparations, which could occur as...
fullContent: SoftBank is reportedly preparing to list its Japanese payments app operator, PayPay, in the United States, potentially raising over $2 billion. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase & Co, Mizuho Financial Group, and Morgan Stanley are leading the IPO preparations, which could occur as early as the final quarter of this year.

summary: Ajay Saraf, who has led ICICI Securities Ltd.’s investment banking division for nearly 15 years, will move to become the head of the Indian firm’s retail stock broking and wealth business, according to people familiar with the matter.
fullContent: Ajay Saraf, who has led ICICI Securities Ltd.’s investment banking division for nearly 15 years, will move to become the head of the Indian firm’s retail stock broking and wealth business, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Chalet Hotels CFO on luxury-only focus, Rs 2,000 crore capex, & why budget hotels aren’t on radar
summary: The company is betting on high entry barriers, a favourable demand–supply gap, and marquee projects in Goa, Delhi, and other prime markets to power its next phase of growth, Nitin Khanna said.

title: Bitcoin Nears Record As Treasury Investors Boost Crypto Market

India’s RBI Said to Have Sold at Least $5 Billion to Boost Rupee
summary: India’s central bank sold US dollars across both onshore and offshore currency markets this month to prop up the rupee as it weakened toward a record low, according to people familiar with the transactions.

title: Trump Putin Meeting | Vance Spoke On The Possibility Of A Settlement Between Russia & Ukraine
Cameron Brandt says Trump-Putin meeting unlikely to spark major market shifts
summary: Geopolitical events have limited long-term impact on fund flows, with investors often viewing dips as buying opportunities. While some money is slowly exiting the US amidst tariff negotiations, it's primarily moving into liquidity funds.
fullContent: Geopolitical events have limited long-term impact on fund flows, with investors often viewing dips as buying opportunities. While some money is slowly exiting the US amidst tariff negotiations, it's primarily moving into liquidity funds. India's fund inflows, previously recovering, have been impacted by new tariffs, particularly on pharmaceuticals, creating uncertainty in the market.
